titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace record 1977.106
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-09T15:58-0500

did.unittitle: Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace record
did.abstract: A decision issued by the Queens County Court of General Sessions of the Peace, dated 1799. The case in question concerned a John Schenck of the town of North Hempstead, Long Island, who sought the court's approval to manumit (or free) an enslaved African-American man named Prince. The court ruled in favor of Schenck and allowed Prince to be freed. The document lists the names of all the judges and lawyers involved with the case.

origination.label: creator

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. This item was formally accessioned in 1977.
